modules.description: This module provides operations for working with database query results through cursor objects. It supports retrieving individual values, iterating over results, mapping transformations, and converting cursors to sequences or lists. Use cases include processing rows from SQL queries efficiently, extracting scalar values like counts, and transforming result sets into structured collections.

This module enables defining and composing type descriptors that map SQL statement parameters and result rows to typed OCaml values. It provides primitive types like `int`, `float`, and `text`, along with tuple combinators (`@>`, `@>>`, `mkp4`, etc.) to structure multi-parameter queries or extract fixed-size result sets. It is particularly useful for safely binding typed arguments to SQL statements and unmarshaling query outputs into structured data like tuples.

This module provides type-safe and exception-safe SQLite database interactions, including connection management, parameterized SQL execution, and mapping query results to OCaml values through typed descriptors and cursor-based iteration. It supports operations on database connections, such as transaction control with savepoints, column metadata retrieval, and handling queries with or without result sets using typed representations. These features are ideal for applications requiring robust database access with guarantees against SQL injection and runtime type errors.
